results.title: Madrid: capital de Espana
results.creator_credit: Egons Tomsons and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: A Spanish language film for first year Spanish students. Views of Madrid, Spain: the principle streets, the airport, Spain’s tallest building, monuments and statues, the bull ring and bullfight. Visits the Prado Museum featuring paintings by El Greco, Goya and Velasquez. Narration by Juan Manuel Garcia.

results.title: Frame by frame: the art of animation
results.creator_credit: Jerry Samuelson, Paul Burnford, Paul Burnford Film Productions and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: This film explores the possibilities of making a frame-by-frame, or animated film. Illustrates a variety of frame-by-frame techniques: still-picture filming (kinestasis), flicker-framing, cut-out animation, people animation (pixillation), direct images on film, and time sequence filming. This film is suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Ant world
results.brief_description: Shows the life style of the common ant. Tells how the class structure of certain ant colonies constitutes a society based on a division of labour. Records home-building and food-gathering techniques and documents the exchange of a salivery substance between a smaller male and larger female ant. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Sunday father
results.creator_credit: Paul Leaf, Sheldon Satin, Films Incorporated and International Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the contemporary situation of a divorced man who takes his daughter on a once-a-week outing on Sunday afternoon. Focuses on the problem of a father trying to be friends with a little girl whom he sometimes feels barely knows him. Featuring Dustin Hoffman and Jane Schisgal with music and vocals by Janis Ian.

results.title: Search and privacy
results.brief_description: Presents realistic contemporary situations to illustrate the problems surrounding the conflict between efficient law enforcement and the right of the individual to be free from unreasonable searches and invasion of privacy. Illustrations are related to the Fourth Amendment of the American Bill of Rights. Made for discussion purposes. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Interrogation and counsel
results.brief_description: This film raises for discussion some alternative police interrogation procedures and the rights of the accused to notification of their rights and, if necessary, to effective legal representation. The Fifth and Sixth Amendments to the American Bill of Rights are presented and related to two simulated cases.

results.title: Growth of intelligence in the pre-school years
results.brief_description: Documents the growth of the thinking processes in the preschool years. Illustrates developmental changes and clarifies certain Piagetian terms often mystifying the student of Piaget.

results.title: Formal thought
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Piaget’s Developmental Theory”.
Illustrates tasks that challenge the thinking of postprimary school students. Involves proportional reasoning, separation of variables, combinatorial logic and the integration of these in an analysis of a balanced beam with weights. Suitable for tertiary level and teachers.

results.title: The Pre-Raphaelite revolt
results.creator_credit: David Thompson, Anne Balfour Fraser and Samaritan Films
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the philosophy of the Pre-Raphaelite painters, who made a concerted effort to “save” art by returning to the “truth of nature”. The narration and the visual content evoke the era of the Pre-Raphaelite in around 1848. The film helps to clarify the individual approaches of the painters and how they achieved the return to nature. Narrated by John Wood and poems of Tennyson, D.G. Rossetti and Christina Rossetti read by Freda Dowie. A fasinating and interesting film.

results.title: The Making of a live television show
results.brief_description: Production of a live television show, from the first meeting of the writers to the dance rehearsal, to the final performance. Shows the pressure on the director and points out that a television presentation requires much pre-planning and work. Suitable for upper secondary level.
